ygData.subject: RE: Clouding
ygData.msgSnippet: I was in MM last night hunting around the lake.  Clouding worked without a hitch for me.  Not only against the mobs around the lake, but the trains from inside
ygData.messageBody:
I was in MM last night hunting around the lake. Clouding worked without a
hitch for me. Not only against the mobs around the lake, but the trains
from inside the castle. We were around the tower from the entrance. I
would con the mobs that came walking back from the zone, granted I didn't
con every mob, but all those I did were indifferent. Sounds like the
wandering buffer is the more likely explanation or somehow the Camo was
overriding the Clouding's protection.

Tomerrilin Loreweaver
Bard of the 23rd Song
Mith Marr Server

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 15, 2000 2:16 PM
To: EQ Bards
Subject: [eqbards] Clouding


From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>

Speaking of Clouding - it has been failing big time lately by Mobs that
are now green to me in Mistmoore. When I was in my mid-to-upper 20's - I
could sing it and get from the zone to the Graveyard completely unmolested.
The Initiates and what have you that spawn along the way would never be a
problem.

Starting a couple weeks ago - they would go agro on me when singing
Clouding and when Regular (not Superior) Camouflage is cast on me. This is
a major train generator.

It seems to me they upgraded these mobs see invis. Someone I grouped
with theorized that some wandering mob casts see invis on them - but who
knows?

Slyde 35 of Xegony
